channel.title: Did JK Rowling fuck up the series ( for you) when she said dumbledoe was gay?
channel.description: So what do you think about it. I think she's just being an attention whore, since her books are done.

item.title: Did JK Rowling fuck up the series ( for you) when she said dumbledoe was gay?
item.dc:creator: @whothe0 the fu superior
item.description:
@whothe0 wrote:

Dumbledore is gay?

Gosh i could imagine what went on.

Dumbledore:ooo harry flex those muscles
Harry:…
Dumbledore: (in his mind) damn, he’s sexy when he casts spells

Voldemort:Ima kill yo ass biyatch!
Dumbledore:you’re sexy when you scream

Read full topic
item.source: Did JK Rowling fuck up the series ( for you) when she said dumbledoe was gay?

item.title: Did JK Rowling fuck up the series ( for you) when she said dumbledoe was gay?
item.dc:creator: @dragonus18 dragonus18
item.description:
@dragonus18 wrote:

MujaheD:

I think she did it to make people tolerate gays. You build a nice character that everyone loves, THEN you tell them hes gay. Chances are people love him too much to reject him. In the end people start tolerating homos…

then the smart ones come by and kick the homo’s asses and its all over again

Read full topic

item.source: Did JK Rowling fuck up the series ( for you) when she said dumbledoe was gay?

item.title: Did JK Rowling fuck up the series ( for you) when she said dumbledoe was gay?
item.dc:creator: @Buzzy Buzzy
item.description:
@Buzzy wrote:

Why would it ruin the series for you.

If he was gay all along then all that means is that a gay person can come in any form…

As for calling her an attention seeking whore, it’s really not that hard to tell that he is, mostly so in the seventh book.
Also, it wasn’t mentioned on the news, and if I wasn’t a fan, and didn’t go out of my way to find out Harry Potter news, I probably would have never known.

So, guess your going to have the stfu or gtfo.

As for saying that the books are horrible, Why did you come to this topic than?

Oh, and just to be an ass:

Speljohan:

No, cause i didn’t read it. The story was too childish for my taste.

Your on MITB asshole.

Read full topic
item.source: Did JK Rowling fuck up the series ( for you) when she said dumbledoe was gay?

item.title: Did JK Rowling fuck up the series ( for you) when she said dumbledoe was gay?
item.dc:creator: @Exception Exception
item.description:
@Exception wrote:

I will agree, the ending of the 7th book was the worst I’ve ever read. The pressure must have gone to her head. When I read “All was well”, I burst out laughing, like way to go JK Rowling!

Read full topic
item.source: Did JK Rowling fuck up the series ( for you) when she said dumbledoe was gay?

item.title: Did JK Rowling fuck up the series ( for you) when she said dumbledoe was gay?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

PaulT:

Harry’s final catechism takes him no closer to any real truth at the end of the seventh book, the moral dilemma is always altruistic martyrdom vs. selfish cowardice, and the plot is so convoluted by the end of the series it reads more like an L. Frank Baum acid trip then a novel.

You cannot equate immature writing with a childish story.

Read full topic
item.source: Did JK Rowling fuck up the series ( for you) when she said dumbledoe was gay?

item.title: Did JK Rowling fuck up the series ( for you) when she said dumbledoe was gay?
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:46, topic:154295”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=210767.msg1869710#msg1869710 date=1194280687]
No, cause i didn’t read it. The story was too childish for my taste.
[/quote]

It is in no way childish.[/quote]

Actually everything appears in a very childish way which doesn’t appeal to me. If you compare with, say David Eddings or Terry Pratchett books you can see the difference immediately.

Read full topic

Harry’s final catechism takes him no closer to any real truth at the end of the seventh book, the moral dilemma is always altruistic martyrdom vs. selfish cowardice, and the plot is so convoluted by the end of the series it reads more like an L. Frank Baum acid trip then a novel.

item.title: Did JK Rowling fuck up the series ( for you) when she said dumbledoe was gay?
item.dc:creator: @Silver_Lining Silver Lining
item.description:
@Silver_Lining wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:39, topic:154295”][quote author=Lothy link=topic=210767.msg1859730#msg1859730 date=1193918556]
I don’t really see the problem. I don’t condone people going out of their way to be gay, but I don’t condemn them either.
Sexuality seldom plays a part in a, supposedly, children’s book anyway.

On a more positive note, I just saw the fifth movie - the girl that plays Tonks looks preetty good.
[/quote]

Pfft, you know it’s all about the Luna…[/quote]I’ve always had a thing for Luna…

Read full topic

item.title: Did JK Rowling fuck up the series ( for you) when she said dumbledoe was gay?
item.dc:creator: @dragonus18 dragonus18
item.description:
@dragonus18 wrote:

tomo6627:

I think it’s quite crafty of her, y’know, to build up the character, make him seem great. By then we all love him, and then Rowling makes a point by saying gays aren’t different.

or… she’s gay herself and wanted to see if people accepted famous gay people?

I never liked harry potter, and no she is not ‘all over the news’ it was not even mentioned on the news here (england).
Its not as if she randomly told everyone, she was asked a question and she answered it, she is far from an attention whore for this, fuck off please.
